description: Students study modern Irish literature in four distinct Irish settings (ancient city, coastal
village, urban capital, lake-country town) where this literature was written.  James Joyce's
Dubliners put Dublin on the map; Irish men and women, some of whom students meet on the trip,
continue to write engagingly about modern life in a variety of locales.  Readings, discussion, and
cultural experiences (including theater, museums, and excursions by van) provide the basis for
daily journal entries and several short papers.  Prerequisite: FYW or equivalent.  Offered in
